page.para: The red raincoat
On Sunday, Manu’s mum gave him a red raincoat.
“Can I wear it?” he asked his mum.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “The sky is blue. It is warm outside.”
On Monday, it was bright and sunny.
“Can I wear my red raincoat today?” asked Manu.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “The sun is shining. You will be too warm.”
On Tuesday the sky was blue.
“Can I wear my red raincoat today?” asked Manu.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “There is only one small cloud in the sky.”
On Wednesday it was hot.
“Can I wear my red raincoat today?” asked Manu.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “It is very hot. You do not need a raincoat.”
On Thursday, there were some clouds in the sky.
“Can I wear my red raincoat today?” asked Manu.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “It is not raining.”
On Friday, there were big dark clouds.
“Can I wear my red raincoat today?” asked Manu.
“No, Manu. You cannot wear your red raincoat today,” said his mum. “There are big dark clouds, but it is not raining.”
On Saturday, it began to rain.
“Rain! Rain! It is raining!” shouted Manu as he ran outside.
“Manu,” called his mum. “You forgot your red raincoat!”
